title: How Sensitive Are Your Stocks to Interest Rates? It’s Time to Find Out
sub_head: As central banks start lifting borrowing costs from near zero, profitless startups are certain to suffer more than telecom companies. For everything in between, investors should learn to look at stocks as if they were bonds.
body:
This is the second column in a Heard on the Street series about the end of zero interest rates.
There is a new urgency to the old question of how much credit falling interest rates should get for your stock portfolio’s strong performance.
